title: What is the Meaning of Sacrifice in Universal and Transcendent Sense?
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses the concept of sacrifice as originating from the chaos of opposing forces. He notes that heroes and gods in primordial myths often battled monsters and wild forces, which were actually a manifestation of themselves. The conquering of chaos through sacrifice led to the emergence of a higher order or law. The author explores the dual effectiveness of sacrifice in renewing the essence of a god or in gaining mastery over wild forces. The text concludes by referencing the generative power of sacrifice in the cycle of myths that feature the creation of mankind and the world.
content: Cosí comprendendolo, puoi scendere alle azioni sacrificali degli uomini e stabilire la doppia direzione in cui esse possono essere efficaci: nel sacri- ficio, puoi accendere e rinnovare l'atto stesso che costi- tuì originariamente l'essenza di un dio, e che, attra- verso la violenza fatta al caos, si tradusse nello « spiri- to » di una legge della vita o della natura; ovvero tu puoi attrarre ed affrontare forze ancora allo stato libero e selvaggio, per esercitar su di esse a mezzo del sacrificio l'atto dominatore e trasfiguratore. (I) Va ricordato, in generale, tutto il ciclo dei miti ove si vede proceder da un sacrificio la generazione o creazione degli uomini e delle cose.[N. d. U.)
last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding the dual direction in which sacrificial actions can be effective allows you to renew and reignite the essence of a god, or to exercise dominion over wild forces through sacrifice. Remembering the cycle of myths where sacrifice leads to creation, you can deduce immediate and determined realizations by adapting sacrificial meanings. With subtle intellect, you can discover the most suitable place, as opposed to ancient times where temples and other sacred places were already saturated with occult influences.
